name: English Lavender
description: Lavandula angustifolia, commonly known as English lavender or true lavender, is a flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae, native to the Mediterranean region. It is a strongly aromatic shrub with narrow, grey-green leaves and violet-blue flowers on long spikes. Lavender has been cultivated for over 2500 years for its essential oil, which is used in perfumery, aromatherapy, and traditional medicine. The plant is valued for its calming and relaxing properties.
